intro: Polyalthia greveana, commonly known as the Malabar flame of the forest, is a tropical evergreen tree native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking red and orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with elliptical leaflets and produces small, fleshy berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in dense forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant in tropical regions.
